meanings.definition: A small bundle or cluster, especially of nerve or muscle fibers.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the fascicles in the body help transmit signals.
meanings.sent2: She studied the fascicles of the muscle to understand its function better.
meanings.sent3: The fascicles in the nerve had a party and sent tingles all over.
meanings.sent4: Like a tiny army, the fascicles of muscles worked together to lift the weight.
meanings.sent5: The fascicles were like a group of friends holding hands, supporting each other.

meanings.definition: A section of a book or manuscript that is published separately.
meanings.sent1: The library had a collection of fascicles from different authors.
meanings.sent2: She eagerly awaited the next fascicle of the novel series.
meanings.sent3: The fascicles of the book decided to have a race to see who finishes first.
meanings.sent4: In the world of knowledge, each fascicle is a treasure waiting to be explored.
meanings.sent5: The fascicles on the shelf whispered stories of their contents, enticing readers.
